Neostalgic Computing is a 6-week course I'm developing on [hyperlink.academy](https://hyperlink.academy/). Through a speculative design process, students will reflect on their relationships with computing technologies and reimagine them from a hyper-personal, retrospective, and healing lens. > Many of us are nostalgic about the technology of our pasts, but what happens when we move from nostalgia—longing for what was—to *neo*stalgia—longing for what could have been? Expanding upon the themes I explored in [Jackie's OS](https://jackieis.online/projects/jackiesos/ "Jackie's OS project page"), this course is an experiment in fostering alternate visions of computing culture through self-reflection and speculative play. The first cohort begins February 2021. Stay tuned to learn more!
